intro: Monadenium renneyi, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent growth form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its resilience, it is often found in rocky or sandy habitats across the Sahara and surrounding areas.
